intro: Cornucopiae involucratum, commonly known as the golden shield plant, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features broad, shield-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green with a waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-rich soils. Cornucopiae involucratum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance in gardens.
